ARABIC: رَسُولٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ يَتْلُوا۟ صُحُفًا مُّطَهَّرَةً

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: a Messenger from Allah reciting purified texts
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: An Apostle from God, reading out hallowed pages
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: a Messenger from Allah, reciting from Purified Scrolls;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: a Messenger (Muhammad) from God, reciting to them parts of the purified,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: (The clear proof is) the Noble Messenger from Allah, who reads the pure pages.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: A Messenger from Allah reciting purified pages.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: An apostle from Allah, reciting pure pages,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: a Messenger from God, reciting pages purified,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: A messenger from Allah, reading purified pages
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: a messenger from God, reciting to them pure scriptures,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: An apostle from Allah rehearsing Writs cleansed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: an apostle from Allah reciting impeccable scriptures,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: An messenger from Allah, rehearsing scriptures kept pure and holy:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: A Messenger (Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) from Allah, reciting (the Quran) purified pages [purified from Al-Batil (falsehood, etc.)].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: A Messenger from Allah reciting Purified Pages
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: A messenger from God reciting purified scripts.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: A Messenger from Allah, reciting purified scriptures
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [98:2] a messenger from God (rasūlun mina’Llāhi substitutes for al-bayyinatu, ‘the clear proof’), namely, the Prophet (s), reciting pages purified, of [all] falsehood,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (A messenger from Allah) i.e. Muhammad (pbuh) (reading) to them (purified pages) pages purified from idolatry
